author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump said that he was likely to impose tariffs on pharmaceuticals as soon as the end of the month and that levies on semiconductors could come soon as well, suggesting that those import taxes could hit alongside broad “reciprocal” rates set for implementation on Aug. 1.
title: Trump Says Drug Tariffs Probable by Aug. 1, Downplays More Deals

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said Scott Bessent was an option to replace Jerome Powell as head of the Federal Reserve but suggested the Treasury secretary was not the leading candidate because of his success in his current role.
title: Bessent Is Not Top Fed Candidate But ‘Very Good,’ Trump Says

author: Catherine Lucey
description: The Office of the US Trade Representative on Tuesday opened an investigation into Brazil over its trade practices and whether they are unfairly restricting US exports to the country, a week after President Donald Trump threatened a 50% tariff on the country.
title: US Trade Representative Opens Section 301 Probe Into Brazil

author: Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Lai, Allison McNeely
description: The Trump administration is finalizing an executive order that would pave the way for 401(k) retirement savings plans to invest in private equity, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: White House Readies Order to Bring Private Equity to 401(k)s

author: Sakura Murakami, Erica Yokoyama
description: Emergency action to lower price of nation’s staple prioritizes votes of urban consumers over rural supporters
title: Japan’s ‘Rice Minister’ Is Ruling Party’s Biggest Election Gamble

author: Erik Wasson
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at how Congress is handling the Trump administration’s spending cuts. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Republicans on Cusp of Decades-Long Goal to Cut PBS, NPR

author: Denis Chabrol
description: A wealthy Guyanese businessman who is sanctioned by the US for alleged tax evasion on gold exports has officially entered the race to lead the oil-rich South American nation.
title: Sanctioned Magnate Launches Outsider Bid to Lead Oil-Rich Guyana

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Stephanie Lai
description: President Donald Trump hailed more than $92 billion in investments in artificial intelligence and energy infrastructure during a visit to Pennsylvania, highlighting his efforts to bolster US competitiveness in the AI field.
title: Trump Hails $92 Billion in Investments for AI, Energy Projects

author: Michelle Ma, Akshat Rathi
description: The billionaire venture capitalist said the Middle East, India and Europe are among the places that will benefit from the president’s crackdown on immigration.
title: Trump Immigration Policies Hit Climate Tech Talent Pipeline, Khosla Says

author: Katia Porzecanski, Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump supported Andrew Cuomo’s decision to stay in New York City’s mayoral race, saying that the former governor had a “shot” at beating democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani.
title: Trump Says Cuomo Should Stay in New York City Mayoral Race

author: Monique Vanek
description: South Africa’s president appointed Mineral and Petroleum Resources Minister Gwede Mantashe as acting police minister with immediate effect.
title: South African President Names Mantashe Acting Police Minister

author: Erik Wasson
description: Senate Republicans agreed to spare global AIDS prevention and treatment programs from spending cuts, a deal that makes chopping funding public broadcasting more likely.
title: Senate Republicans to Restore Funds for AIDS Programs in DOGE Bill

author: Mark Bergen, Ian King, Mackenzie Hawkins
description: Nvidia Corp.’s Jensen Huang spent months telling everyone what a grave mistake the US was making restricting shipments of artificial intelligence processors to China — with little sign that his argument was swaying anyone.
title: Nvidia’s Huang Wins China Reprieve in Rare Trade War Reversal

author: Yash Roy, Maeve Sheehey
description: House Republican leaders’ plans to pass a series of industry-friendly crypto regulatory measures hit a bump Tuesday as they failed to win an important procedural vote.
title: House’s ‘Crypto Week’ Hits a Bump After GOP Conservatives Rebel

author: Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano
description: Donald Trump’s plan to allow the European Union pay for arms supplied to Ukraine is piling pressure on EU officials negotiating how to finance the bloc’s defense-spending ambitions.
title: Trump’s Plan for Europe to Foot Ukraine Bill Ups Budget Pressure

author: Andrew Rosati, Barbara Nascimento
description: Donald Trump tried to settle a political score when he dragged Brazil to the center of his trade war. In doing so, he’s threatening the presidential chances of the man investors believe has the best shot at beating Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.
title: Trump’s Brazil Tariffs Risk Undermining Lula’s Pro-Business Rival

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: The finance ministers of the euro area’s two biggest economies pledged to join forces to provide additional support for European startups.
title: Germany and France Vow to Help Europe’s Startups Tap Financing

author: Ari Natter
description: The US may depart the International Energy Agency without changes to forecasting that Republicans have criticized as unrealistically green, President Donald Trump’s energy chief said.
title: US Threatens to Abandon IEA Over Green-Leaning Energy Forecasts

author: Eric Martin
description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte warned that Brazil, China and India will face secondary sanctions from the US if Russia doesn’t negotiate a peace deal with Ukraine, and said they should lean on President Vladimir Putin to agree to a ceasefire.
title: NATO Chief Warns China, India and Brazil Over Russia Links

author: Catherine Lucey
description: US President Donald Trump said he plans to meet with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer during an upcoming visit to Scotland to “refine” their trade pact.
title: Trump Says He’ll Meet Starmer in Scotland to ‘Refine’ Trade Pact

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump is fighting to end automatic citizenship for children born to parents who are in the country unlawfully or on temporary visas, part of his broader crackdown on undocumented immigrants and a change that could overturn more than a century of legal precedent.
title: Understanding the Legal Fight Over Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Order

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Public perceptions of China have improved over the past year, according to a new survey, while those of the US have dimmed — a trend that coincides with President Donald Trump returning to office.
title: China’s Reputation Improves in Pew Survey as US Sees Drop

author: Derek Decloet
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he believes trade negotiations with the US will “intensify” but acknowledged there’s little evidence the Trump administration is willing to cut a deal that would completely drop tariffs.
title: Carney Hints Tariffs Will Stay, Sees Talks With US Ramping Up

author: William Horobin, Samy Adghirni
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou proposed scrapping two national holidays, part of a drastic effort to repair public finances likely to prompt a parliamentary backlash in the fall.
title: France Proposes Axing Two Public Holidays to Tackle Budget Hole

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: European countries should do everything they can to avoid a trade war with the US, said Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni.
title: Italy’s Meloni Says Trade War With US to Be Avoided at All Costs

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Mike Waltz, the former national security adviser who is now President Donald Trump’s nominee for United Nations ambassador, pledged to return the world body to its “first principles” and challenge China’s growing influence.
title: Waltz Vows to Challenge China If Confirmed to UN Ambassador Role

author: William Horobin
description: France is on the cliff edge as its debt continues to balloon, Prime Minister Francois Bayrou said on Tuesday as he set out plans to sharply narrow the budget deficit next year.
title: French Premier Says Country on Cliff Edge as Debt Soars

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump said he reached a deal with Indonesia, without providing any specifics of what is included in the accord.
title: Trump Says Deal Struck With Indonesia, Provides No Details

author: Damian Garde
description: A former Pfizer Inc. scientist denied an allegation made by House Republicans that he conspired to delay the release of Covid shot data to hurt Donald Trump’s 2020 election prospects, the latest twist in a dispute that demonstrates how vaccines are increasingly becoming a political flashpoint.
title: Ex-Pfizer Doctor Tells Congress He Didn’t Delay Covid Shot Data

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou will propose abolishing two public holidays as part of a plan to repair the country’s public finances, Le Parisien newspaper reported on Tuesday.
title: French PM to Propose Cutting Two Public Holidays, Parisien Says

author: Julian Lee
description: Flows from Baltic ports hit the highest in almost 10 months
title: Russia’s Crude Shipments Rebound Ahead of Trump Sanctions Threat

author: Stephanie Lai, Jackie Davalos
description: President Donald Trump plans to deliver a major address on artificial intelligence next week to outline his vision for ensuring American dominance in AI, marking his biggest statement on an emerging technology at the heart of the US-China rivalry.
title: Trump Set to Outline AI Priorities in Speech Asserting US Edge

author: Daniel Hornak
description: The European Union assured Slovakia that it would take measures to soften the impact of a bloc-wide ban on Russian gas supplies from 2028 after Prime Minister Robert Fico demanded safeguards.
title: EU Offers Slovakia Assurances on Proposed Ban of Russian Gas

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The head of Britain’s budget watchdog warned that tax increases may not be enough to bring the UK’s spiraling debt burden under control since the strategy could backfire by slowing the economy.
title: Tax Hikes Insufficient to Fix UK Debt Spiral, OBR’s Hughes Says

author: Daniel Flatley, Stephanie Lai
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested the deadline for a US-China tariff truce slated to end next month is flexible, saying that talks between the world’s largest economies are in a “very good place” ahead of an expected meeting in coming weeks.
title: Bessent Tells Markets Not to Worry About China Tariff Deadline

author: Yujing Liu
description: China’s humming factories threw a lifeline to an economy struggling with weak demand in the second quarter. That’s also given policymakers space to fight deflation — if they choose to do more than just hitting their growth target.
title: China’s Growth Momentum Offers Xi Rare Window to Fight Deflation

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, Europe’s longest-serving premier who’s facing the toughest political challenge to his rule, said his party could survive an eventual change of leadership.
title: Hungary’s Orban Broaches Topic of Succession After Poll Plunge

author: Daniel Flatley, Annmarie Hordern, Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested that Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell should step down from the central bank’s board when his term as chair is up in May 2026.
title: Bessent Suggests Powell Should Leave Fed Board in May

author: Piotr Skolimowski
description: US President Donald Trump asked Volodymyr Zelenskiy whether Ukraine could strike Moscow if provided with US long-range weapons, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people briefed about a call the two leaders held on July 4.
title: Trump Asked Zelenskiy If Ukraine Could Hit Moscow, FT Says

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Natalia Drozdiak
description: Russia rejected pressure from Donald Trump after the US president threatened to impose stiff economic penalties on Moscow if it doesn’t end hostilities with Ukraine within 50 days, though the Kremlin indicated it would review his latest stance.
title: Russia Brushes Aside Trump’s Tariff Threat Over War in Ukraine

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa has encountered a fresh setback as he seeks to clamp down on rampant crime.
title: Ramaphosa’s War on Crime Set Back as Scandal Embroils Minister

author: Stacey Vanek Smith
description: Jonathan Lieberman followed his father into the profession. His dad never had to WhatsApp anxious customers from bed.
title: It Used To Be a Low-Drama Gig. Customs Broker Is Now a High-Stress Job

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The US president seems to have realized Vladimir Putin wasn’t serious about peace talks to end his war on Ukraine.
title: Trump Lobs the Ukraine Ball Into Putin’s Court

author: Dan Williams
description: An Israeli ultra-Orthodox party said it’s walking out of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition, threatening to leave the government with a razor-thin majority in parliament.
title: Netanyahu’s Coalition Shrinks After Ultra-Orthodox Party Quits

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: The United Nations has warned of Afghanistan’s worsening humanitarian crisis as tens of thousands of Afghans are being deported daily, many of them from Iran following its war with Israel.
title: UN Warns of Afghan Refugee Crisis as Iran Deports Thousands

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Most Brazilians see Donald Trump’s threat of a 50% tariff as unjustified meddling in internal affairs and believe President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration is responding appropriately, according to a new poll.
title: Brazilians Back Lula Against Trump, Calling Tariffs Unjustified

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra asked a court for more time to file a defense statement in a case that could see her dismissed over the handling of a border dispute.
title: Suspended Thai PM Asks Court For More Time to Respond to Ethics Case

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK is reintroducing grants of as much as £3,750 ($5,000) to support electric vehicle purchases, as the Labour government seeks to bolster its beleaguered auto industry and meet net zero goals.
title: UK to Bring Back £3,750 Grants to Support Purchases of Some EVs

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s cabinet will be reshuffled next week after a delay stoked by a junior coalition partner, government spokesman Adam Szlapka told TVN24 on Tuesday.
title: Polish Government Set for Reshuffle Next Week, Spokesman Says

author: Charlie Zhu, Emma Dong
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping called for the acceleration of a “new model” for property development, advocating a more measured approach to urban planning and upgrades, while falling short of investor expectations for more aggressive policies.
title: Xi Urges ‘New Model’ for China Urban Development in Rare Meeting

author: Swati Pandey
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Australia values its relationship with China and will approach it in a “calm and consistent” manner, during opening remarks at a meeting with President Xi Jinping.
title: Australia PM Will Approach China Ties in Calm, Consistent Manner

author: Beril Akman, Firat Kozok
description: Ekrem Imamoglu is expected in court on Wednesday as his CHP party condemns what it calls a widening crackdown on its mayors and officials.
title: Turkey's Opposition Under Fire as Erdogan Rival Goes on Trial

author: William Horobin
description: Prime Minister Francois Bayrou will outline a plan on Tuesday to sharply narrow France’s deficit, setting the stage for a parliamentary battle that risks triggering another government collapse.
title: France’s Government Risks Backlash With Stringent Budget Plan

author: Eko Listiyorini, Norman Harsono
description: Indonesia, the world’s biggest coal exporter, may impose an export levy on the fossil fuel in a bid to boost state revenues, according to local media reports that cited a government minister.
title: Indonesia Looking at Levy on Coal Exports to Boost State Coffers

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party and its junior coalition partner Komeito are at risk of losing its majority in the upper house in elections this Sunday, potentially weakening Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and his minority government’s standing further amid ongoing trade negotiations with the US.
title: Japan’s Ruling Parties at Risk of Losing Upper House Majority

author: Alastair Gale
description: Tokyo highlighted its concern over probing activity by Chinese ships and aircraft around Japan and Taiwan with new warnings about such activity in its annual defense white paper.
title: Japan’s Defense Paper Ups Concern Over China’s Probing Activity
